questions.text: What is the primary function of a firewall?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic.

questions.text: Which type of firewall operates at the network layer?
questions.explanation: A packet filtering firewall operates at the network layer.

questions.text: A proxy firewall inspects traffic at the application layer.
questions.explanation: A proxy firewall inspects traffic at the application layer.

questions.text: What is the purpose of an Intrusion Detection System (IDS)?
questions.explanation: An IDS monitors a network or systems for malicious activity.

questions.text: What is the purpose of an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)?
questions.explanation: An IPS actively prevents or blocks intrusions that are detected.

questions.text: An IPS is placed out-of-band and passively monitors network traffic.
questions.explanation: An IPS is placed in-line and actively prevents or blocks intrusions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of antivirus software?
questions.explanation: Signature-based antivirus software detects malware based on known signatures.

questions.text: What is the purpose of heuristic analysis in antivirus software?
questions.explanation: Heuristic analysis detects malware based on suspicious behavior.

questions.text: A VPN encrypts network traffic.
questions.explanation: A VPN (Virtual Private Network) encrypts network traffic to provide secure communication.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a SIEM system?
questions.explanation: A SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system aggregates and analyzes security logs.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of authentication factor?
questions.explanation: Something you know (e.g., password) is a type of authentication factor.

questions.text: Biometrics is an example of something you have authentication factor.
questions.explanation: Biometrics is an example of something you are authentication factor.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a honeypot?
questions.explanation: A honeypot is a decoy system designed to attract attackers.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of vulnerability scanner?
questions.explanation: Nessus is a vulnerability scanner.

questions.text: A vulnerability scanner identifies and exploits vulnerabilities.
questions.explanation: A vulnerability scanner identifies vulnerabilities, but does not exploit them.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a web application firewall (WAF)?
questions.explanation: A WAF protects web applications from attacks.

questions.text: Which of the following is a common type of attack that a WAF protects against?
questions.explanation: SQL injection is a common type of attack that a WAF protects against.

questions.text: A data loss prevention (DLP) system prevents unauthorized access to data.
questions.explanation: A data loss prevention (DLP) system prevents sensitive data from leaving the organization.

questions.text: What is the purpose of endpoint detection and response (EDR) systems?
questions.explanation: EDR systems monitor endpoints for suspicious activity and respond to threats.

questions.text: Which of the following is a security product used for email security?
questions.explanation: Spam filters are used for email security.
